question: Which instrument is used to measure the size of a frictional force in the laboratory?

A block slides down a rough slope. In which direction does the frictional force act?
Why do tractors designed for soft, muddy ground have very wide tires?
options: To increase the friction so it moves faster
To increase the pressure on the mud
To increase the surface area and reduce pressure
To decrease the weight of the tractor
answer: To increase the surface area and reduce pressure

question: A skydiver opens his parachute. Why does he slow down?
options: The air resistance increases significantly due to larger surface area
The air pressure decreases at high altitude
answer: The air resistance increases significantly due to larger surface area

question: If you take a suction cup to the Moon (where there is no atmosphere), will it stick to a smooth vertical wall?
options: Yes, because the wall is smooth
No, because there is no atmospheric pressure to push it against the wall
No, because the suction cup becomes weightless
answer: No, because there is no atmospheric pressure to push it against the wall

question: Why do your ears often 'pop' when you travel up a high mountain?
options: Atmospheric pressure decreases as you go higher
Atmospheric pressure increases as you go higher
Gravity becomes stronger at the top of the mountain
There is more friction in the air at high altitudes
answer: Atmospheric pressure decreases as you go higher

question: Calculate the Weight of a 200g apple on Earth (g = 10 N/kg). (Note the unit is grams!)
Which statement correctly defines Weight?
options: Weight is the amount of matter in an object
Weight is the amount of gravitational force acting on an object
Weight is constant throughout the universe
answer: Weight is the amount of gravitational force acting on an object
